description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a71nd","text":"We have been assembling the genomes of many Drosophila species. This protocol fork allows for the sequencing of single wild-caught flies using Nanopore MinION sequencers, in contrast to our previous protocol that originally used gDNA extracted from tens or hundreds of flies from an inbred line.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv195","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aeoa2","text":"While fork_info.title: DNA extraction and Nanopore library prep from 15-30 whole flies

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"68foh","text":"Flies were collected from the wild and stored in 95% ethanol at -20C. We have successfully assembled genomes from samples ranging from 4 months to 15 years old. Younger samples perform better, of course. Ideally the samples are no older than 5 years and stored properly (e.g. alcohol has not evaporated).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jnqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"66k00","text":"Apart from the gDNA extraction steps, this protocol mostly follows the standard LSK110 protocol. Slight modifications were made to improve library recovery and pore occupancy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
